intro: Acrostichum appendiculatum, commonly known as the broadleaf hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often in heathland environments. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are broad and leathery, providing a distinctive appearance in its natural habitat.
